TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was detained on remand until DATE on suspicion of CARDINAL attempted murders . The court based its detention order on a reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences , on the severity of the likely penalty , which gave rise to a fear that the applicant would obstruct the proceedings , and on the risk of the applicant ’s going into hiding as he had done previously .
CARDINAL . On an unknown date a bill of indictment was lodged . The applicant was charged with CARDINAL attempted murders and possession of an unlicensed weapon .

CARDINAL . Subsequent decisions on the extension of the applicant ’s pre - trial detention were taken on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . In all the above - mentioned decisions the courts relied on the same grounds for detention as those given in the first detention order . In some of them the courts also referred to the complexity of the case , the need to conduct further investigations , the probability of collusion between the applicant and other co - accused and exertion of unlawful pressure on witnesses by the applicant . They also stressed that the applicant had previously gone into hiding .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the decisions extending his detention on several occasions . All of his appeals were dismissed .
CARDINAL . On many occasions the applicant requested release from detention or the imposition of a more lenient preventive measure . His requests were dismissed .
CARDINAL . Hearings were held on the following dates : CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG changed the legal qualification of the offences and convicted the applicant of attempted robbery endangering the lives others as well as possession of a weapon . It sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . Both the prosecutor and the applicant lodged appeals .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the judgment and remitted the case .

CARDINAL . A hearing was held on DATE . A hearing of DATE was cancelled due to a lay judge ’s absence . A hearing of DATE was adjourned since the accused who had been detained had not been transported to the hearing , and a hearing of CARDINAL DATE was adjourned since the applicant had challenged the impartiality of the judges . Subsequent hearings were held on DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a judgment . It convicted the applicant of CARDINAL attempted murder and acquitted him of the other attempted murder and possession of an unlicensed weapon . The prosecutor and the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment and remitted the case .

CARDINAL . Subsequent hearings were held on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of CARDINAL attempted murders and possession of a weapon and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal which he had drafted himself . On DATE the applicant appealed through a lawyer .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . The judgment is final .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning the imposition of detention on remand ( aresztowanie tymczasowe ) , the grounds for its prolongation , release from detention and rules governing other , so - called “ preventive measures ” ( środki zapobiegawcze ) are stated in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE and PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .
